target_name: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
computation_definitions:
National data (Type1)
This is the national produced statistics in the ROK that best corresponds to the definition of UN SDGs indicators.
Download the national metadata file for more information.
indicator_name: Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases
data_name: Number of neglected tropical disease cases
indicator_definition: The number of neglected tropical disease cases is the sum of Hansen’s disease, hydrophobia, and dengue fever cases
computation_calculations: Compiling reports received by the integrated disease and health management system from medical institutions(including public health centers)
global_indicator_name: Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases
graph_title: Number of neglected tropical disease cases
source_organisation_1: Division of Zoonotic and Vector Borne Disease Control, Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency
source_other_info_1: Data provided by the Rare and Imported Pathogens Laboratory, PHE Centre for Emergency Preparedness and Reponse, Porton Down. Note that the totals in the table are higher than the total number of cases stated in the report as some cases travelled to more than one country. All possible travel destinations are included for analysis if no dates of travel or onset have been stated; in reality a case is likely to have acquired his/her infection in only one country.
source_other_info_2: Data provided by the Rare and Imported Pathogens Laboratory, PHE Porton and collated by the Travel and Migrant Health Section.
title: Untitled
